trig.title: How to Use Trigonometric Functions (sin, cos, tan)

Press the sin button and sin( will appear. Enter the angle, close with ), and press =.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ sin(30) = 0.5 ‚Äî sine of 30 degrees
‚Ä¢ cos(60) = 0.5 ‚Äî cosine of 60 degrees

Inverse trig: Press 2nd ‚Üí INV to switch to sin‚Åª¬π, cos‚Åª¬π, tan‚Åª¬π. For example, sin‚Åª¬π(0.5) = 30 gives you the angle from a value.

Hyperbolic functions: Press 2nd twice to enter HYP mode for sinh, cosh, tanh.

log.title: How to Use Log Functions (log, ln)
log.desc:
The log button computes the common logarithm (base 10), and ln computes the natural logarithm (base e ‚âà 2.718).

Examples:
‚Ä¢ log(100) = 2 ‚Äî because 10¬≤ = 100
‚Ä¢ log(1000) = 3 ‚Äî because 10¬≥ = 1000
‚Ä¢ ln(e) = 1 ‚Äî natural log of e

Inverse functions: In INV mode, these become 10À£ and eÀ£. 10^(3) = 1000, e^(2) ‚âà 7.389.

Applications: pH concentration (log), half-life calculations (ln), decibel conversion (10√ólog), and more.

memory.title: How to Use Memory Functions (M+, M-, MR, MC)
memory.desc:

‚Ä¢ M‚àí ‚Äî Subtract current result from memory
‚Ä¢ MR ‚Äî Recall stored memory value into expression

degRad.q: Q. What is the difference between DEG (Degrees) and RAD (Radians)?
degRad.a:
DEG (Degrees) divides a full circle into 360 parts, while RAD (Radians) measures angles by the ratio of arc length to radius. Use DEG for everyday angle calculations and RAD for calculus or physics. Toggle between them using the DEG/RAD button at the top-right.

Conversion formula: 180¬∞ = œÄ rad (approximately 3.14159 rad)

history.q: Q. Where is the calculation history stored?
history.a: Calculation history is stored in your browser's localStorage, keeping up to 50 entries. History persists when you refresh the page in the same browser. However, clearing browser data or using incognito mode will reset the history. Click the clock icon at the top-left to view history, and click any previous expression to recall it.

keyboard.q: Q. How do I use keyboard input?
keyboard.a: You can type numbers (0-9), arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /), parentheses, and decimal point (.) directly from your keyboard. Press Enter or = to calculate, Backspace to delete, and Esc to clear all (AC). Use ^ for powers, ! for factorial, and % for percent.

memory.q: Q. How do I use the Memory (M+, M-, MR, MC) functions?
memory.a: Memory lets you store intermediate results during calculations. For example, calculate 25 + 30 = 55, then press M+ to store 55 in memory. After doing other calculations, press MR to recall the stored value of 55. M‚àí subtracts from memory, and MC clears memory. When memory holds a value, an M indicator appears on the display.

precision.q: Q. How accurate are the calculation results?
precision.a: This calculator computes with 14 significant digits of precision. It uses JavaScript's IEEE 754 64-bit floating-point arithmetic internally, with the math.js library for precise results. This is sufficient for virtually all engineering calculations.

description.title: What is a Stopwatch?
description.p1: A stopwatch is a time measurement tool that precisely measures elapsed time. It can measure time down to milliseconds (1/100th of a second) from the moment you press start until you stop. Unlike a timer that counts down from a set time to zero, a stopwatch starts from zero and measures time indefinitely.

diff.q: What's the difference between a stopwatch and a timer?
diff.a: A stopwatch starts from zero and measures elapsed time indefinitely, while a timer counts down from a set time to zero. Use a stopwatch for 'how long did it take' and a timer for 'how much time is left'.

save.q: Will my records be saved if I close the browser?
save.a: Lap records are automatically saved in your browser's local storage. You can access previous records when returning with the same browser. However, clearing browser data will also delete records.

mobile.q: Can I use it on mobile devices?
mobile.a: Yes, with responsive design it works optimally on smartphones, tablets, and PCs.

maxTime.a: There's no time limit - measure indefinitely. Times over 1 hour are displayed in hours:minutes:seconds.milliseconds format.

export.a: Yes, click 'Export Excel' to download all lap records as a CSV file. Open it in Excel or Google Sheets.

q1.q: What is the Pomodoro Technique?
q1.a: Developed by Francesco Cirillo in the 1980s. One 'pomodoro' is 25 min focus + 5 min break. After 4 pomodoros, take a 15-30 min long break. Short focus periods with regular breaks maintain high productivity without fatigue.

q2.q: Can I change the focus time from 25 minutes?
q2.a: Yes, use the ¬± buttons next to the focus time to adjust from 1 to 90 minutes in 5-minute increments. Break times are adjustable too.

q3.q: Where are statistics saved?
q3.a: All statistics are stored in your browser's local storage. Records are kept for the last 90 days and can be viewed anytime in the same browser.

q4.q: What is the auto-start feature?
q4.a: When the 'Auto Start' checkbox is enabled, break starts automatically after focus ends, and the next focus starts automatically after break ends. No need to press buttons ‚Äî your flow stays uninterrupted.

q1.q: What is Tabata training?
q1.a: Developed by Dr. Izumi Tabata in Japan. It's a high-intensity interval training of 20s all-out exercise + 10s rest for 8 sets (4 minutes total). It improves both aerobic and anaerobic capacity in a short time.

q2.q: What's the difference between HIIT and Tabata?
q2.a: Tabata is a specific type of HIIT. HIIT is the general term for high-intensity interval training with flexible work/rest times and rounds. Tabata is a fixed protocol of 20s/10s/8 rounds.

q3.q: Can I change the number of rounds?
q3.a: Yes, use the ¬± buttons to set anywhere from 1 to 20 rounds. Adjust based on your fitness level.

q4.q: Can I pause during a workout?
q4.a: Yes, press the Stop button or Space bar to pause. Resume to continue from where you left off.

q1.q: How many timers can I add?
q1.a: You can add up to 4 timers. A message will appear if you try to add more than 4.

q2.q: What happens when multiple timers finish at the same time?
q2.a: Each timer triggers its own alarm when complete and turns red. If they finish simultaneously, alarms sound in succession.

definition.title: What is an Exchange Rate Calculator?
definition.desc: An exchange rate calculator is an online tool that compares and converts currency values between different countries in real time. This calculator uses official standard rates from the Export-Import Bank of Korea and supports over 40 currencies including USD, EUR, JPY, and CNY. It helps you accurately convert amounts for travel, international shopping, remittances, and study abroad expenses. Note that data may not be updated on non-business days (weekends and Korean holidays).

case1.desc: Plan your total travel budget by calculating accommodation, transportation, and meal costs in local currency before your trip. For example, instantly check how much 100,000 KRW converts to Japanese Yen for a trip to Japan, helping you decide the right amount and timing for currency exchange.

case2.title: International Shopping Price Comparison

steps.step3: Compare Results: View converted amounts for all currencies at a glance. Useful for travel budgeting or comparing international prices.

update.q: How often is the exchange rate updated?
update.a: This service uses the Export-Import Bank of Korea API, updated around 11 AM on business days (KST). Data is not updated on weekends and Korean holidays.

actual.q: Can I exchange money at the rate shown here?
actual.a: The displayed rate is the standard rate for reference only. Actual exchange rates vary by bank's preferential rates and fees. Please check with your bank for actual rates.

jpy100.a: Japanese Yen is quoted per 100 units due to its small value. For example, if JPY(100) = 900 KRW, then 1 JPY ‚âà 9 KRW.

save.q: How can I save on exchange fees?
save.a: Use bank mobile apps (up to 90% discount), visit private exchange offices in Korea, or use travel cards like Travel Wallet for fee-free transactions abroad.

privacy.title: Privacy Notice
privacy.text: All amounts and currency selections you enter are processed entirely in your browser and are never sent to or stored on any external server. Exchange rate data is retrieved from the public Korea Exim Bank API. We do not collect or store any personal information.

info.title: Simple vs Compound Interest?
info.simpleDesc: Interest is calculated only on the principal amount. Interest earned is not reinvested, so the interest amount remains constant each period.
info.compoundDesc: Interest is added to the principal, and future interest is calculated on the new total. This creates the 'compounding effect' where your money grows faster over time.

tips.title: üí° Investment Tips
tips.desc: For short-term (under 1 year) savings, the difference between simple and compound interest is small. However, for long-term (3+ years) investments, compound interest is significantly more advantageous. Utilizing tax-advantaged savings accounts can also save on the 15.4% interest income tax.

difference.q: What is the difference between simple and compound interest?
difference.a: Simple interest is calculated only on the principal, so interest stays the same each period. Compound interest is calculated on principal plus accumulated interest, growing exponentially over time.

tax.q: What is the interest income tax rate?
tax.a: In Korea, the standard interest income tax is 15.4% (14% income tax + 1.4% local tax). Tax-free or tax-advantaged products may have different rates.

which.q: Which is better: savings account or time deposit?
which.a: If you have a lump sum, time deposits earn more interest. For monthly savings, installment savings help build saving habits. Choose based on your situation.

compound.q: Do monthly compound interest products actually exist?
compound.a: Most bank deposits use simple interest. Monthly compounding is mainly offered by CMA accounts and some special financial products. Always check product details before signing up.

taxfree.a: Tax-free comprehensive savings accounts allow eligible individuals (aged 65+, persons with disabilities, etc.) to save without the 15.4% interest income tax. Up to 50 million KRW per person can be deposited, and all interest is received in full ‚Äî more favorable than standard taxed products.

earlyWithdraw.q: What happens to interest if I withdraw early?
earlyWithdraw.a: If you break your deposit/savings before maturity, a reduced early withdrawal rate applies instead of the agreed rate. It typically drops to less than half the original rate, and shorter holding periods result in even lower rates. To avoid early withdrawal, keep an emergency fund separate.

definition.title: What is Interest Calculation?
definition.desc: Interest is the cost of borrowing money or the return for depositing money. When you open a savings account at a bank, the bank uses your funds and pays interest as compensation. Higher rates, longer periods, and compound methods yield more interest.

formula.title: Interest Formulas
formula.simple: Simple Interest = Principal √ó Annual Rate √ó Period (years)
formula.compound: Compound Maturity = Principal √ó (1 + Annual Rate √∑ 12) ^ Months
formula.savings: Savings Simple Interest = Monthly Deposit √ó Months √ó (Months+1) √∑ 2 √ó (Annual Rate √∑ 12)
formula.note: ‚Äª Interest income tax of 15.4% (14% income tax + 1.4% local tax) is withheld from interest.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.q1: Q. How is severance pay calculated?
faq.a1: Severance Pay = Average Daily Wage √ó 30 days √ó (Service days √∑ 365). The average daily wage is calculated by dividing the total wages for the 3 months before resignation (including base salary, allowances, bonuses, and leave pay) by the total number of days in those 3 months (approximately 91 days).
faq.q2: Q. Can part-time or contract workers receive severance pay?
faq.a2: Yes, they can. Regardless of employment type (full-time, contract, or part-time), workers who have been continuously employed for more than 1 year and worked an average of 15+ hours per week over a 4-week period are entitled to severance pay under the Labor Standards Act.
faq.q3: Q. Are bonuses and annual leave pay included in the calculation?
faq.a3: Yes, they are included. 3/12 (three months' worth) of annual bonuses and 3/12 of annual leave allowance are factored into the average wage calculation. In this calculator, simply enter the amounts in the 'Total Annual Bonus' and 'Annual Leave Allowance' fields to have them automatically reflected.
faq.q4: Q. What is the deadline for severance pay payment?
faq.a4: Employers must pay severance within 14 days of the employee's resignation date. Late payment incurs penalty interest at 20% per annum. However, the deadline may be extended by mutual agreement between the employer and employee.
faq.q5: Q. Can I get an interim settlement (mid-term withdrawal)?
faq.a5: In principle, interim settlement of severance pay is prohibited. However, exceptions are allowed for legally specified reasons such as purchasing a home (for non-homeowners), paying rent deposits, medical care for the employee or dependents lasting 6+ months, or natural disasters.
faq.q6: Q. Is severance pay subject to taxation?
faq.a6: Yes, severance pay is subject to retirement income tax. The tax is calculated based on your years of service and total severance amount, with longer service periods receiving greater deduction benefits. The amount shown in this calculator is pre-tax, so your actual take-home amount will be lower after tax deductions.

definition.title: What is Severance Pay?
definition.desc: Severance pay is a statutory benefit required under Korea's Employee Retirement Benefit Security Act. Employers must pay severance to any employee who has worked continuously for 1 year or more upon their resignation or retirement. This applies to all employment types, including full-time, contract, and part-time workers, as long as they meet the eligibility requirements.

formula.title: Severance Pay Formula
formula.line1: Average Daily Wage = Total wages for 3 months before resignation √∑ Total days in those 3 months (91 days)
formula.line2: Severance Pay = Average Daily Wage √ó 30 days √ó (Total service days √∑ 365 days)
formula.note: ‚Äª Total wages include base salary, allowances, bonuses (3/12 of annual bonus), and annual leave allowance (3/12 of annual leave pay).

lawInfo.title: Korea's Age Unification Law
lawInfo.desc: Since June 28, 2023, Korea unified all legal and administrative age standards to 'International Age' (Man-nai).
lawInfo.point1: üìã Contracts, official documents, and legal applications now use International Age.
lawInfo.point2: ‚öñÔ∏è Some laws like Military Service Act still use Year Age.
lawInfo.point3: üóìÔ∏è Korean Age is still commonly used in daily conversations.

man.title: üéÇ International Age (Man Age)
man.desc: Starts at 0 from birth and adds 1 year on every birthday. This is the global standard and legal standard in Korea since June 2023.

year.title: üìÖ Year Age
year.desc: Current Year - Birth Year. Used in some laws like Military Service Act and Youth Protection Act (buying alcohol/tobacco).

korean.title: üá∞üá∑ Korean Age (Counting Age)
korean.desc: Starts at 1 from birth and adds 1 year on every January 1st. Still commonly used in daily life in Korea.

difference.q: What is the difference between International Age and Korean Age?
difference.a: International Age starts at 0 at birth and adds 1 on each birthday. Korean Age starts at 1 at birth and adds 1 every January 1st. So Korean Age is typically 1-2 years older than International Age.

law.q: What is Korea's 2023 Age Unification Law?
law.a: Since June 28, 2023, Korea unified legal age to 'International Age' (Man-nai). Contracts, official documents, and legal applications now use International Age as the standard.

yearAge.a: Year Age (Current Year - Birth Year) is used in some Korean laws like Military Service Act (determining conscription eligibility) and Youth Protection Act (alcohol/tobacco purchase age).

global.q: How do other countries calculate age?
global.a: Most countries use International Age. The Korean counting age system is quite unique - only a few East Asian countries had similar traditions historically.

faq.a1: 1GB equals 1,024MB. Computers use binary (base-2), so calculations are based on 1,024 (2^10) rather than 1,000.
faq.a2: 1TB equals 1,024GB. Terabytes are commonly used for large hard drives and cloud storage.
faq.q3: Q. Why does my hard drive show less space than advertised?
faq.a3: Hard drive manufacturers calculate 1GB = 1,000MB, while operating systems (Windows) use 1GB = 1,024MB. This difference causes the displayed capacity to appear smaller.
faq.q4: Q. What's the difference between KB and KiB?
faq.a4: KB (kilobyte) is 1,000 bytes, while KiB (kibibyte) is 1,024 bytes. This tool uses the 1,024-based calculation commonly used in computing.

info.title: What is Base64?
info.desc: Base64 is an encoding scheme that converts binary data into ASCII string format. It uses 64 characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /) to represent data and is widely used for safely transmitting binary data in email attachments, web APIs, and data transfer.

q1.q: Q. Is Base64 encoding encryption?
q1.a: No, Base64 is encoding, not encryption. Anyone can easily decode it, so it's not suitable for protecting sensitive data. It should only be used for data format conversion purposes.

q2.q: Q. What is URL-Safe Base64?
q2.a: URL-Safe Base64 is a variant that replaces unsafe URL characters (+, /, =) with safe characters (-, _). It's useful when using Base64 strings in URL parameters or filenames.

q3.q: Q. Why does Base64 encoding increase size?
q3.a: Base64 converts 6 bits into 8-bit ASCII characters, so the encoded data size increases by approximately 33%. (3 bytes ‚Üí 4 characters)

q4.q: Q. What is the difference between URL-Safe and standard Base64?
q4.a: Standard Base64 uses +, /, and = characters, which have special meanings in URLs. URL-Safe Base64 replaces + with -, / with _, and removes padding (=), making it safe to use in URLs and filenames.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Q. What is a HEX color code?
faq.a1: HEX (hexadecimal) represents colors using base-16 numbers in #RRGGBB format. Each pair represents Red, Green, Blue from 00-FF (0-255). Example: #FF0000 is pure red.
faq.q2: Q. What's the difference between RGB and HSL?
faq.a2: RGB defines colors by mixing Red, Green, and Blue values. HSL uses Hue (color type), Saturation (intensity), and Lightness (brightness), making it more intuitive for color adjustments.
faq.q3: Q. Which color format should I use for web?
faq.a3: CSS supports HEX, RGB, and HSL. HEX is compact and commonly used, RGB is great with alpha transparency, and HSL is useful when you need to adjust colors programmatically.
faq.q4: Q. How do I copy color codes?

q1.q: Q. Why is URL encoding necessary?
q1.a: URLs were originally designed to use only ASCII characters. To include special characters or non-ASCII text in URLs, they must be converted to %XX format so browsers and servers can process them correctly.

q2.q: Q. Is space %20 or +?
q2.a: In URL paths, spaces are encoded as %20. In form data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded), spaces may be represented as +. Generally, using %20 is safer.

q3.q: Q. Should I use encodeURIComponent or encodeURI?
q3.a: Use encodeURIComponent when encoding query parameter values. Use encodeURI for complete URLs, but in most cases, encodeURIComponent is safer.

q4.q: Q. Is it a problem if URLs become long with %XX encoding?
q4.a: Long encoded URLs work fine functionally. Browsers display them decoded in the address bar for readability. However, some older systems may have URL length limits.

q5.q: Q. What is double encoding?
q5.a: Double encoding occurs when an already encoded string is encoded again. For example, %20 (space) becomes %2520. If the server decodes only once, it gets the encoded string instead of the original value. This tool automatically detects double encoding and warns you.

q1.q: Q. How many bytes is one Korean character?
q1.a: In UTF-8 encoding, one composed Korean character (Hangul syllable) is 3 bytes. English letters, numbers, and basic special characters are 1 byte each. In EUC-KR encoding, Korean characters are 2 bytes.

q2.q: Q. How are character limits calculated for applications?
q2.a: Most applications use "characters with spaces" as the standard. However, some may use "without spaces", so always check the specific requirements in the job posting.

q3.q: Q. How is the word count calculated?
q3.a: Words are counted as units separated by spaces. Korean uses spacing rules, while English uses spaces to separate words. Useful for checking word count in English essays.

q4.q: Q. How is reading time calculated?
q4.a: Reading time is estimated based on approximately 500 characters per minute for Korean and 200-250 words per minute for English. Actual reading speed may vary depending on content difficulty.

q5.q: Q. What are the character limits for different SNS platforms?
q5.a: Twitter (X) allows 280 characters, Instagram captions 2,200 characters, Facebook 63,206 characters, and YouTube titles 100 characters. This tool shows real-time comparison against each platform's limit.

q6.q: Q. Do essay character limits include spaces?
q6.a: Most character limits count 'with spaces'. However, some organizations use 'without spaces', so always check the specific requirements. You can toggle between 'with spaces' and 'without spaces' in the goal setting feature.

q7.q: Q. How do I set a target character count?

info.title: What is JSON?
info.desc: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data interchange format. It's easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate. Widely used in web APIs and configuration files.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight text-based format for storing and transmitting data. It's easy for humans to read and machines to parse, widely used in web APIs and configuration files.
faq.q2: Q. What is a JSON formatter used for?
faq.a2: It's used to prettify compressed JSON for readability or to find and fix JSON syntax errors. Useful for API response analysis, config file editing, and data validation.
faq.q3: Q. What's the difference between JSON and JavaScript objects?
faq.a3: JSON is a string-based data format, while JavaScript objects are a programming language data type. In JSON, keys must be wrapped in double quotes, and functions or undefined cannot be values.
faq.q4: Q. Is there a maximum file size for JSON?
faq.a4: JSON itself has no size limit, but this tool runs in the browser, so it works best with data within a few MB. For very large files, consider using a dedicated editor.
faq.a5: Minify removes unnecessary whitespace and line breaks from JSON files to reduce file size. This improves transfer speed and saves storage when deploying API responses or configuration files.

ovulation.title: üå∏ What is Ovulation?
ovulation.desc: Ovulation is the release of an egg from the ovary. It typically occurs 14 days before the next expected period. This calculator estimates the ovulation date based on this principle.

fertile.title: üî∂ Fertile Window
fertile.desc: The fertile window spans from 5 days before ovulation to 1 day after. Sperm can survive up to 5 days in the female body, and the egg survives about 12-24 hours after ovulation, making this the highest probability period for conception.

safe.title: üîµ Safe Period
safe.desc: The safe period refers to days outside the fertile window. It is divided into early (from period start to before fertile window) and late (after fertile window to before next period). However, it is not 100% safe, so use this information as a reference only.

caution.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notice
caution.desc:
This calculator provides estimates based on regular menstrual cycles. Ovulation timing can vary due to stress, weight changes, illness, and other factors.
For accurate ovulation tracking, consider using ovulation test kits or consulting a gynecologist.
Do not use this as medical basis for contraception or pregnancy planning.

calculation.q: Q. How is the ovulation date calculated?
calculation.a: Ovulation typically occurs 14 days before the next expected period. For example, with a 28-day cycle, ovulation is expected around day 14 from the last period start date.

fertile.q: Q. When is the fertile window?
fertile.a: The fertile window spans from 5 days before ovulation to 1 day after, approximately 6-7 days total. Sperm can survive up to 5 days in the body, and an egg survives about 24 hours after ovulation.

irregular.q: Q. Can I use this with irregular cycles?
irregular.a: This calculator is based on regular menstrual cycles. For irregular cycles, use it as a reference only and consider ovulation test kits or consulting a gynecologist for accurate tracking.

safe.q: Q. Is the safe period really safe?
safe.a: The safe period has a relatively lower chance of pregnancy, but it is not 100% safe. Ovulation can vary from predictions, so relying solely on this for contraception is not recommended.

q1.q: What is a regular expression?
q1.a: A regular expression (regex) is a formal language for defining and searching patterns in strings. It is supported by most programming languages and text editors, and is used for data validation, extraction, and replacement.

q2.q: What are flags and what types are available?
q2.a: Flags modify how a regex behaves. Common flags include g (global search), i (case-insensitive), m (multiline mode), s (dotAll - dot matches newline), and u (unicode support).

q3.q: What are capture groups?
q3.a: Capture groups are parts of a regex enclosed in parentheses (). They allow you to extract specific portions of matched strings and reference them as $1, $2, etc. during replacement.

q4.q: Is this tool free?

q5.q: What regex syntax is supported?
q5.a: This tool uses JavaScript's (ECMAScript) regex engine. It supports most standard regex syntax including character classes, quantifiers, anchors, lookahead/lookbehind, and more.

privacy.title: Privacy Notice

description.title: What is BMI (Body Mass Index)?
description.p1: BMI (Body Mass Index) is an internationally standardized indicator that uses the relationship between height and weight to determine whether body weight is appropriate. Devised by Belgian mathematician Adolphe Quetelet in 1832, this index is currently used by the World Health Organization (WHO) as the basic criterion for obesity assessment.
description.p2: BMI is calculated by dividing weight (kg) by the square of height (m). For example, a person who is 170cm tall and weighs 65kg has a BMI of 65 / (1.70)^2 = 22.49. This value is used to classify underweight, normal, overweight, and obesity.

feat1.title: Instant BMI Calculation
feat1.desc: Simply enter your height and weight to get your BMI calculated in real-time with instant results.

steps.s1: Enter Height ‚Äî Enter your height in the height (cm) field. (e.g. 170)
steps.s2: Enter Weight ‚Äî Enter your current weight in the weight (kg) field. (e.g. 65)
steps.s3: Click Calculate ‚Äî Press the 'Calculate BMI' button to see results.
steps.s4: Check Results ‚Äî Review your BMI value, obesity classification, and normal weight range.

uc1.title: Setting Diet Goals
uc1.desc: Check your current BMI and set a healthy diet plan targeting a weight within the normal range.

uc4.title: Weight Change Tracking
uc4.desc: Regularly measure your BMI to numerically track weight management results and maintain motivation.

q1.q: Does a normal BMI mean I'm healthy?
q1.a: BMI is calculated solely from the ratio of weight to height, so it doesn't reflect muscle mass, body fat percentage, or visceral fat. Even with a normal BMI, body fat percentage may be high. For an accurate health assessment, it's recommended to get a comprehensive evaluation at a medical facility.

q2.q: Do muscular people get a high BMI?
q2.a: Yes, since BMI is calculated only from weight and height, athletes and bodybuilders with high muscle mass may show overweight or obese BMI values. In such cases, measuring body fat percentage alongside BMI provides a more accurate picture.

q3.q: Do the same BMI criteria apply to children and adolescents?
q3.a: No. Since children and adolescents are still growing, adult BMI criteria cannot be directly applied. For pediatric populations, obesity is determined by percentile compared to others of the same age and sex.

q4.q: Are BMI criteria different for Asians?
q4.a: While WHO general criteria are universal, Asians tend to have a higher body fat percentage at the same BMI. Some Asian countries classify BMI 23+ as overweight and 25+ as obese. This calculator uses international WHO standards.

q5.q: Is my data safe with this calculator?
q5.a: Yes, all calculations are processed in your browser and your height and weight information is never sent to any server. No personal health data is collected or stored.

privacy.title: Privacy Notice
privacy.text: This BMI calculator processes all calculations in your browser. Your height and weight information is never transmitted to or stored on any server. Personal health data is processed only on your device.

q1.q: What is the VAT rate in South Korea?
q1.a: The standard VAT rate in South Korea is 10%. This applies to most goods and services. However, some items such as unprocessed food, medical and educational services are exempt from VAT.

q2.q: What is the difference between supply amount and total amount?
q2.a: The supply amount is the net transaction amount excluding VAT, while the total amount is the supply amount plus VAT. For example, if the supply amount is 1,000,000 won, adding 100,000 won VAT gives a total of 1,100,000 won.

q3.q: How do I reverse-calculate VAT from the total amount?
q3.a: To reverse-calculate VAT from the total (VAT-inclusive) amount: Total / 1.1 = Supply Amount, Total - Supply Amount = VAT. Use the 'Total Amount ‚Üí VAT' mode in this calculator for automatic calculation.

q4.q: Is the VAT rate different for simplified taxpayers?
q4.a: Simplified taxpayers have value-added rates of 1.5% to 4% depending on the business type. You can change the tax rate in this calculator to compute VAT for simplified taxpayers.

q5.q: When is VAT filing due?
q5.a: General taxpayers file final returns in January (for Jul-Dec) and July (for Jan-Jun), with preliminary returns in April and October. Simplified taxpayers file once a year in January.

q1.q: What is the difference between Equal Payment and Equal Principal?
q1.a: Equal Payment (amortized) pays the same total amount (principal + interest) every month. Initial burden is lower but total interest is higher. Equal Principal pays the same principal amount each month plus interest on the remaining balance. Initial payments are higher but decrease over time, resulting in less total interest.

q2.q: When is Bullet repayment advantageous?
q2.a: Bullet repayment pays only interest during the loan period and repays the full principal at maturity. Monthly burden is the lowest but total interest is the highest. It is suitable when you need short-term funds or expect a lump sum at maturity.

q3.q: Which repayment method is best for a mortgage?
q3.a: Equal Payment is the most common for long-term mortgages. It makes household budget management easy since you pay the same amount each month. If you can afford higher initial payments, Equal Principal can reduce your total interest.

q4.q: Are early repayment fees included in the calculation?

q1.q: How is the conversion rate determined?

q2.q: Is there a cap on the conversion rate?
q2.a: Yes, under the Housing Lease Protection Act, there is an upper limit on the conversion rate. Landlords cannot charge monthly rent exceeding the base rate + surcharge (currently 2%). Tenants can request a refund for any excess charges.

q3.q: What is ban-jeonse (semi-monthly rent)?
q3.a: Ban-jeonse is a hybrid between Jeonse and monthly rent, where you pay a certain deposit and monthly rent for the remaining amount. It can be seen as converting part of the Jeonse deposit into monthly rent payments.

q4.q: Can the calculation differ from the actual contract?
q4.a: This calculator uses the legal conversion rate. Actual contracts may vary based on landlord-tenant negotiation, market conditions, and local pricing. Please use the results as a reference.

q5.q: What is Jeonse deposit return insurance?
q5.a: Jeonse deposit return insurance protects tenants in case the landlord cannot return the deposit. It can be purchased from HUG, SGI Seoul Guarantee, or HF Korea Housing Finance Corporation. It is recommended when converting between rent types to protect your deposit.

q1.q: What is a UUID?
q1.a: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) is a 128-bit number used to uniquely identify information in computer systems. It is designed to be unique across all systems without requiring a central authority.

q2.q: How is UUID v4 generated?
q2.a: UUID v4 is generated using cryptographically secure random numbers. Of the 128 bits, 6 bits are fixed for version and variant information, and the remaining 122 bits are randomly generated. The probability of collision is extremely low.

q3.q: Can I remove hyphens from a UUID?
q3.a: Yes, hyphens are only for readability and do not affect the uniqueness of the UUID. Storing UUIDs without hyphens as 32 characters can save storage space in databases.

q4.q: Are UUIDs sequential?
q4.a: UUID v4 is completely random and not sequential. If you need sequential IDs, consider UUID v7 or other methods.

q5.q: Can I generate multiple UUIDs at once?

q1.q: What is a hash?
q1.a: A hash is a function that converts data of any length into a fixed-length unique string. The same input always produces the same hash value, but it is practically impossible to recover the original data from the hash.

q2.q: What is the difference between MD5 and SHA-256?
q2.a: MD5 produces a 128-bit (32-character) hash and is fast, but collisions have been found making it unsuitable for security. SHA-256 produces a 256-bit (64-character) hash with no known collisions, making it suitable for security applications.

q3.q: Can I check the hash of a file?
q3.a: Yes, switch to file mode and drag & drop or select a file. Hash values for MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512 will all be computed simultaneously.

q4.q: Is hashing the same as encryption?
q4.a: No. Encryption uses a key to transform data and can be reversed, while hashing is a one-way function that cannot recover the original. Hashing is used for integrity checks, password storage, checksums, and more.

q5.q: Which hash algorithm should I use?
q5.a: SHA-256 is the most common for file integrity checks. For security-critical applications, use SHA-256 or higher. MD5 and SHA-1 are not recommended for security but can still be used for quick checksums.

q1.q: What is a Unix timestamp?
q1.a: A Unix timestamp (Epoch Time) is the number of seconds (or milliseconds) elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC (Unix Epoch). It is a standard way to represent time across operating systems, programming languages, and databases.

q2.q: How do I distinguish between seconds and milliseconds?
q2.a: Typically, a 10-digit number represents seconds, while a 13-digit number represents milliseconds. This tool includes auto-detection that analyzes the number of digits in your input, and you can also manually select the unit.

q3.q: What is the Year 2038 problem (Y2K38)?
q3.a: On 32-bit systems, the Unix timestamp will experience integer overflow on January 19, 2038 at 03:14:07 UTC. 64-bit systems are not affected, and most modern systems have already transitioned to 64-bit.

q4.q: What is the difference between UTC and local time?
q4.a: UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) is the global standard time, while local time is adjusted for the user's timezone. For example, KST (Korea Standard Time) is UTC+9, meaning it is 9 hours ahead of UTC. Unix timestamps themselves are always UTC-based regardless of timezone.

q5.q: Is my data sent to any server?
q5.a: No. All conversions are processed with JavaScript in your browser. No data is transmitted to any server. Use it with confidence.

q1.q: What is JWT?
q1.a: JWT (JSON Web Token) is a standard (RFC 7519) for securely transmitting information between parties as a JSON object. It consists of three parts: Header, Payload, and Signature, and is mainly used for authentication and information exchange.

q2.q: Is it safe to decode a JWT?
q2.a: JWT Header and Payload are only Base64Url-encoded, not encrypted. Anyone can decode and view the contents. Sensitive information should not be included in the JWT Payload.

q3.q: What are exp, iat, and nbf?
q3.a: exp (Expiration Time) is the token expiration time, iat (Issued At) is the token issuance time, and nbf (Not Before) is the start time when the token becomes valid. All are recorded as Unix timestamps (in seconds).

q4.q: How do I check if a JWT token has expired?
q4.a: Compare the 'exp' claim in the JWT Payload with the current time. This decoder automatically determines expiration and displays 'Expired' or 'Valid' status.

q5.q: Is my JWT token stored on the server?
q5.a: No. This tool performs all decoding in the browser. The JWT token you enter is never sent to any server, and is completely deleted when you close the page.

q1.q: What is the difference between discount rate and margin rate?
q1.a: Discount rate represents how much a product is discounted relative to its original price. For example, selling a $100 item for $80 is a 20% discount. Margin rate is the ratio of profit (margin) to the selling price - in the same example, the margin rate is 25% ($20/$80).

q2.q: Can I reverse-calculate the original price from the discounted price?
q2.a: Yes, if you know the discounted price and discount rate, you can calculate the original price. The formula is 'Original Price = Discounted Price / (1 - Discount Rate/100)'. For example, if a 30% discounted price is $70, the original price is $70 / 0.7 = $100.

q3.q: Are 50% margin and 50% discount the same thing?
q3.a: No. Margin rate and discount rate have different bases. If the original price is $100 and it's discounted to $50, the discount rate is 50% (based on original). But if cost is $50 and selling price is $100, the margin rate is 50% (based on selling price).

q4.q: What is an appropriate margin rate?
q4.a: Appropriate margin rates vary by industry. Generally, retail is 20-50%, food service is 60-70%, manufacturing is 10-30%, and services are 30-60%. However, this can vary depending on competition and cost structure.

q5.q: What is the difference between markup rate and margin rate?
q5.a: Markup rate is the ratio of profit to cost, while margin rate is the ratio of profit to selling price. If cost is $100 and selling price is $150, the markup rate is 50% ($50/$100) and the margin rate is 33.3% ($50/$150).

q1.q: What is the 3.3% freelancer withholding tax?
q1.a: When paying freelancers (business income earners), the payer withholds 3.0% income tax and 0.3% local tax, totaling 3.3%, and remits it to the tax office.

q2.q: Is 3.3% the final tax?
q2.a: No. 3.3% is a prepaid tax (withholding). The actual tax is settled through comprehensive income tax filing in May. You may receive a refund after applying expenses and deductions.

q3.q: Can freelancers deduct business expenses?
q3.a: Yes. Freelancers can deduct necessary business expenses such as equipment, office rent, transportation, and communication costs. Standard expense rates or actual bookkeeping can be used.

q4.q: Do freelancers need social insurance?
q4.a: Freelancers are not eligible for employment or industrial accident insurance. However, they must enroll in National Pension and Health Insurance as regional subscribers, paying premiums based on income level.

q5.q: Can I get a tax refund on withheld taxes?
q5.a: Yes. If your actual tax after deductions and credits is less than total withholding, you receive a refund. This is common for those with low income or high business expenses. Apply during May tax filing.

q1.q: What is securities transaction tax?
q1.a: Securities transaction tax is a tax imposed when selling stocks. As of 2026 in Korea, both KOSPI and KOSDAQ have a 0.18% tax rate. No tax is charged on purchases ‚Äî only on the sell amount.

q2.q: How is commission calculated?
q2.a: Commission is charged on both buy and sell transactions. It is calculated by multiplying the trade amount (price x quantity) by the commission rate. Rates vary from 0.003% to 0.5% depending on the broker and trading method (online/offline/mobile). The default 0.015% represents the online trading average.

q3.q: What is the break-even point (BEP)?
q3.a: The break-even point is the price at which you neither profit nor lose, after accounting for all fees and taxes. You must sell above this price to generate actual profit. It factors in buy commission, sell commission, and securities transaction tax.

q4.q: What is the 2026 transaction tax rate?
q4.a: As of 2026, both KOSPI and KOSDAQ have a securities transaction tax rate of 0.18%. This has been gradually reduced from 0.20% in 2023. Note that the special rural development tax is separate. This calculator only reflects the securities transaction tax.

q1.q: What are HTML entities?
q1.a: HTML entities are codes used to represent characters with special meaning in HTML or characters that are difficult to display. For example, '<' is represented as '<' and '&' as '&'. There are three forms: Named (&), Numeric (&), and Hex (&).

q2.q: Why is HTML entity conversion necessary?
q2.a: In HTML, characters like <, >, and & are interpreted as the start of tags or entities. To display these characters as text, they must be converted to entities. It's also essential for XSS prevention, source code display, and special character insertion.

q3.q: What's the difference between Named and Numeric entities?
q3.a: Named entities use descriptive names like < and ©, while Numeric entities use Unicode code point numbers like < and ©. Named entities are easier to remember, while Numeric entities can represent any Unicode character.

q4.q: Do I need to convert all characters to entities?
q4.a: No. Only 4 characters must be converted: <, >, &, and ". Other special characters can be optionally converted as needed. This tool automatically converts the essential characters.

q5.q: Where is my input data stored?
q5.a: Your input data is processed entirely within your browser and is never sent to any server. All data is cleared when you close the page.

q1.q: What's the difference between PNG and JPG?
q1.a: PNG uses lossless compression with transparency support, ideal for logos/icons. JPG uses lossy compression, ideal for photos with smaller file sizes.

q2.q: What is WebP?
q2.a: WebP is an image format developed by Google that provides 25-35% smaller files than JPG with the same quality. Supported by most modern browsers.

q3.q: What happens when converting a transparent image to JPG?
q3.a: Since JPG doesn't support transparency, transparent areas will be replaced with a white background. Use PNG or WebP if you need transparency.

q4.q: Does conversion reduce quality?
q4.a: PNG is lossless with no quality loss. For JPG/WebP, quality above 80% is virtually indistinguishable from the original.

q5.q: Are images uploaded to any server?
q5.a: No, all conversions are performed locally using the browser's Canvas API. Images are never transmitted to any external server.

q1.q: What is a favicon?
q1.a: A favicon is a small icon for a website, displayed in browser tabs, bookmarks, and home screens. It's an important element for brand identity.

q2.q: What kind of image should I use?
q2.a: Square (1:1 ratio) images are recommended. Using a high-resolution image of 512x512 or larger will produce the best results.

q3.q: Should I use ICO or PNG format?
q3.a: ICO is for browser tab icons (can contain multiple sizes), PNG is for web apps and mobile. It's best to provide both formats.

q4.q: What is each favicon size used for?
q4.a: 16x16 for browser tabs, 32x32 for high-DPI tabs, 192x192 for Android home screen, and 512x512 for PWA splash screens.

q5.q: How do I apply a favicon to my website?
q5.a: Upload the generated favicon files to your website root and add <link> tags to the HTML <head> section. HTML code snippets are provided after generation.
